question.text: When pollen grains of a flower of a plant pollinate the stigma of flower of another plant, it is called

options.text: 'A' is a vegetative cell which gives rise to male gametes and 'B' is a generative cell which produces pollen tube
'A' is a generative cell which gives rise to pollen tube and 'B' is a vegetative cell which form male gametes
'A' is a vegetative cell with abundant food reserve and 'B' is a generative cell which form male gametes
'A' is a generative cell which forms male gametes and 'B' is a vegetative cell which produces pollen tube

options.text: Statements I and II are incorrect

options.text: a, c and e are correct
